channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Ex-principal and tutors found guilty of helping students cheat during O-level exams
item.description:
July 07, 2020 3:47 PM

SINGAPORE - The principal of an education centre and three of her tutors schemed to help six students cheat during the 2016 O-level examinations.

item.title: 157 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 20 in the community, 3 imported
item.description:
July 07, 2020 3:27 PM

The 20 community cases comprise 12 Singaporeans or permanent residents, and eight work pass holders, said the Ministry of Health.

item.title: Reformative training for man who fled after causing extensive burns to former colleague
item.description:
July 07, 2020 2:05 PM

SINGAPORE - After causing a former colleague to suffer extensive burns while they working in a Swensen's outlet in 2017, Mohammad Firdaus Mohammad Nazeer went on the run.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on July 7
A familiar face in Punggol West, PAP's Sun Xueling connects offline and online
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

"Hard-working" is the word operations executive Jack Kow, 40, uses to describe Ms Sun Xueling, the incumbent MP in Punggol West.

item.title: 7 months' jail for cop who stole, pawned two police-issued iPads
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A policewoman misappropriated two police-issued iPads worth more than $900 in total and pawned them at a shop. Hemavathy Gunasekaran got $300 in return, a court heard.

item.title: 2,000 more degree places in Singapore offered this year
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

The six autonomous universities here have stepped up to offer around 2,000 more places this year because of the disruptions caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: President of Crisis Centre barred from fund raising
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Following investigations into its fund-raising activities, Crisis Centre (Singapore) president Dennis Lee Wen Da has been prohibited from conducting any fund-raising appeals, while the welfare organisation itself has also been restricted in this aspect.

item.title: Another coronavirus will hit humans within a decade, warns expert
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Covid-19 is the third coronavirus to jump from animals to humans, but it will not be the last, warns Professor Wang Linfa, director of the Programme in Emerging Infectious Diseases at Duke-NUS Medical School.

item.title: After a looooong wait, the zoo reopens
NCID studying to see if coronavirus naturally airborne
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

But even if it is, the current measures in place here would be sufficient to reduce transmission rates, NCID senior consultant Kalisvar Marimuthu said.

item.title: Zoo draws nearly 2,000 visitors on first day of reopening
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Close to 2,000 people visited the Singapore Zoo yesterday, the first day of the reopening of the zoo, Jurong Bird Park and the River Safari to the public.

item.title: Maid, 34, arrested after 95-year-old woman found dead
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A 34-year-old maid from Myanmar has been arrested after being accused of killing a 95-year-old woman in a landed home in Upper Serangoon.

item.title: Coronavirus: 10,000 seniors get first batch of TraceTogether tokens
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Recipients include those who are living on their own, have poor family support, are physically frail, or do not own or use digital devices.

item.title: Caning and jail for duo who sexually assaulted, raped intoxicated teen
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Two young men, who sexually assaulted and raped an intoxicated 18-year-old girl after watching a friend violate her, were sentenced to jail and caning yesterday.

item.title: Covid-19 patients visited Jewel, Orchard Road malls while infectious
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Several malls in Orchard Road as well as Jewel Changi Airport are among places visited by Covid-19 patients while they were still infectious, said the Ministry of Health (MOH) yesterday.

item.title: Jail for dealer who stole casino chips worth over $100k
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Seeking to pay off his debts to unlicensed moneylenders, a dealer at the Resorts World Sentosa (RWS) casino misappropriated casino chips worth more than $100,000 in total last year.

item.title: Coronavirus: Contact tracing app update fixes battery drain in iPhones
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

An app update rolled out at the weekend allows TraceTogether to run in the background on iPhones to exchange Bluetooth "handshakes" with nearby devices for contact tracing.

item.title: MRT among best performers globally, hits reliability high
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

The MRT network has clocked another record: 1.6 million train-km between delays for the 12-month period that ended last month, up from 1.4 million for the year up to March this year.

item.title: Singapore GE2020: Portable booths for wheelchair users and stencils for visually impaired
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Assistance will be given to people with disabilities to enable them to vote independently in the general election on Friday.

item.title: NParks probing venomous box jellyfish sighting
item.description:
July 07, 2020 5:00 AM

One of the most deadly animals on earth, usually found off the coasts of Malaysia, Thailand and Australia, has been spotted in Singapore's waters.

item.title: Coronavirus: Orchard Road malls, Jewel among places visited by Covid-19 patients while they were infectious
item.description:
July 07, 2020 12:10 AM

The average number of new daily cases in the community has increased to 12 per day in the past week, from an average of seven cases per day in the week before that.
